description: Morning bells and saffron light guide you through Ahmedabad's sacred lanes — a musical temple walk.

items.name: Shri Hanumanji Temple
items.description: Situated in Shahibaug, the Shri Hanumanji Temple is one of the oldest temples in Ahmedabad. This large yet eye-catching sanctuary was established by Pandit Gajanan Prasad almost 100 years ago. However, it still has remained in an intact condition and proudly houses a gorgeous gold-plated statue of Lord Hanuman. The interior of the temple is decorated with the sayings of Lord Rama. The temple generally gets a lot of devotees during Tuesdays and Saturdays. Therefore, if you want to avoid traffic and congestion, then make sure to visit this temple during the other days of the week.
items.location_hint: Cantonment Area, Airport Road, Shahibag, Ahmedabad

items.name: Hutheesing Jain Temple
items.description: Known as one of the best temples in Ahmedabad, Hutheesing Temple showcases the beautiful culture of the Jain religion. It was built in the 18th century by a prosperous merchant named Seth Hathisingh. The temple has entirely been made with white marble, which is known to be holy for the Jain devotees. The interior of the temple is filled with beautiful hand carvings, which makes it look very beautiful during the night. Along with this, there are also 52 distinctive sub-shrines present here, which are dedicated to numerous Tirthankars, including Dharamanath. To relish its actual charm, make sure to visit this temple during Mahavir Jayanti Festival. However, before visiting the temple, make sure to wear traditional dresses to avoid any kind of inconvenience.
items.location_hint: Shahbag Road, Bardolpura, Delhi Darwaja, Ahmedabad

items.name: Vaishno Devi Temple
items.description: When talking about the famous temples in Ahmedabad, it is almost impossible to forget about the Vaishno Devi Temple. Situated near the Gandhinagar Road, this elegant holy place is dedicated to goddess Vaishno, who is known to be an incarnation of Goddess Durga. However, it is a replica of the Vaishno Devi Temple in Jammu & Kashmir. So, if you have visited the original temple before, then you might find a lot of similarities between them. The sanctuary has been built upon a man-made hill. Therefore, if you want to visit it, then you would have to climb up the slope. The best time to visit the Vaishno Devi Temple is during the Navratri festival.
items.location_hint: Vaishno Devi Circle, Sarkhej, Gandhinagar Highway, Khodiyar, Ahmedabad

items.name: Shree Jagannath Temple
items.description: Situated near the Jamalpur Darwaja, the Shree Jagannath Temple is believed to be one of the oldest Hindu temples in Ahmedabad. This glorious piece of architecture houses the idols of numerous deities like Jagannath, his younger sister Subhadra, and his brother Balabhadra. The grand celebration of Rath Yatra started here in the year of 1878 and, since then, it has been celebrated every year. So, if you are thinking to visit here and savor its cultural vibrancy, then make sure to come here during this festival. However, while visiting, make sure to wear traditional clothing to avoid any issues.

items.name: Akshardham Temple
items.description: If you are visiting the largest city of Gujarat for the first time, then it would be most convenient for you to start from the Akshardham temple in Ahmedabad. Ruling over a 23 acre of space, this beautiful sanctuary enchants the tourists with its enthralling architectural beauty. The Akshardham Temple is devoted to Lord Swaminathan and his philosophies as well as thoughts about life. Therefore, in this place, you will be able to find a gold-plated statue of Lord Swaminathan, which has a height of almost seven feet.

items.name: Modhera Sun Temple
items.description: Dedicated to the glorious Sun God, the Modhera Sun temple of Ahmedabad is situated near the Becharaji Highway of Modhera. It is believed to be built during the 11th century, making it one of the oldest temples in Ahmedabad. The architectural style of the temple showcases the old yet world-renowned Chalukya style, which is known to be quite sophisticated. Therefore, it looks quite different than most of the other Sun Temples of India. You can visit this beautiful sanctuary at any time of the year. However, along with the temple, if you also want to admire its surroundings, then make sure to come here during the months of October to December.

items.name: Shree Swami Narayan Temple
items.description: Like most of the other previously-mentioned sanctuaries, Shree Swami Narayan Temple, too, exhibits its architectural splendor in a grand way. The interior, as well as the exterior of the temple, has been made with Burmese teak wood, which is considered to be the main reason behind the unparalleled beauty of this temple. Along with Narayan Temple, the shrine complex also houses numerous other edifices, such as Akshar Bhawan, Temple for Women, Rang Mahal, etc. So, if you want to enjoy a serene walk among the deities, then make sure to visit the Shree Swami Narayan Temple at least once during your stay.
items.location_hint: Shahbag Road, Jain Colony, Shahibaug, Ahmedabad

items.name: Devendrashwar Mahadev Temple
items.description: Situated only a few miles away from the Ahmedabad Rail Station, the Devendrashwar Mahadev Temple is considered to be the holiest place in the city. This temple exhibits a beautiful and ornate idol of Goddess Durga and a small statue of the deity Mahadev. Unlike a few other Shiva temples in Ahmedabad, this one is known to be quite big and spacious. Therefore, even if the place is over-crowded, you will have no issues while watching the aartis and prayers. If you are coming to Ahmedabad for touring purposes, then you can visit here during any time of the year. However, if you want to feel the cultural vivacity of this place, then make sure to come here during Navratri.

items.name: Bhadrakali Maa Temple
items.description: The temple is devoted to the deity, Bhadrakali, which is known to be one of the forms of the Goddess Kali. It was built in the 14th century during the reign of Ahmed Shah, a colonist of Ahmedabad. Navaratri is probably the best time for you to visit this beautiful temple as this festival is known to be celebrated here with the most gaiety. During this time, numerous food fests also get organized around the temple, which is excellent news for foodies.

items.name: Iskcon Temple
items.description: If you are looking to get the real essence of the spiritual charm of Ahmedabad, then the Iskcon temple in Ahmedabad is a must-visit for you. Situated at the heart of the former capital of Gujarat, this exquisite piece of architecture is considered to be one of the best Radha Krishna temples in Ahmedabad. Along with the aesthetic idols of the deities, Radha and Krishna, this temple also comes with a gorgeous interior, which will surely make you spellbound. Besides savoring the sensational charm of this holy place, you can also get some souvenirs, such as T-shirts, perfume, books, etc, from the in-house shops.
items.location_hint: Satellite Road, Sarkhej – Gandhinagar Highway, Ahmedabad
